title: Strengthening System Design Practical Competencies: Threshold Concept-Based Scientific Inquiry: Prototypes and Logical-Ontological Frameworks

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational scientific literacy and observational skills through everyday experiences
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Learners can explain the five threshold concept characteristics (transformativity, irreversibility, integrativity, boundedness, and alikeness) essential for understanding the nature of scientific phenomena.
Learners can analyze prototype cases to identify core characteristics of scientific concepts and apply them to real-world problems.
Learners can interpret everyday scientific phenomena from a new perspective using the logic-ontological analysis method.
Learners can recognize the 'troublesome' nature of threshold concepts and employ strategies to resolve cognitive conflicts arising during the learning process.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
